results.title: Marriage for moderns: Jealousy
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers and Irving Jacoby
results.brief_description: Incidents from the life of a young married couple portray the results of a treacherous imagination and a lack of faith and understanding in a marriage relationship. Stresses the importance of continuous self-appraisal and indicates that a basic change of attitude is often necessary in order to uproot a tendency to distort and dramatize insignificant conjectures.

results.title: Marriage for moderns: it takes all kinds
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers, Irving Jacoby and Alexander Hammid
results.brief_description: The right marriage partner need not be one’s exact counterpart, but for a happy marriage two personalities must complement each other. this film shows a series of young people, each one reacting to an identical tense situation, and each one disclosing the essential pattern of his or her personality. Successful marriages, the film stresses, are those where the partners choose each other with care, with a sure knowledge of each other, and then accept each other for what they are - not for what each might wish the other to be.

results.title: Marriage for moderns: In time of trouble
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers and Willard Van Dyke
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the experiences of a couple whose happy marriage is jeopardized by a selfish lack of understanding of the partnership aspects of married life. When Mrs Denkman comes for counsel to Dr Burns, the clergyman who married her, she takes a wise step. Dr Burns is able to advise her on remedial measures for her marriage, which is declining because of problems revealed in her husband’s heavy drinking.

results.title: Marriage and divorce
results.brief_description: No ceremony symbolises the hopes of man and woman than that or marriage. Every day is someone’s wedding day. Yet in a world full of disturbing realities, one out of every three couples (in America) is heading for trouble. This film surveys the problem of broken homes and offers the opinions of experts as to what should be done.

results.title: Marriage
results.brief_description: An historical look at the instruction of marriage and the changing role of women within marriage leads to an examination of marriage in contemporary society. Sociologist Jessie Bernard provides an insight into marriage relationships, a Catholic priest lectures to engaged Catholic couples, and a marriage counsellor helps a couple to communicate.

results.title: Marnie [DVD]
results.brief_description: Marnie is a psychodrama with a background of crime and suspense. Tippi Hedren is Marnie, a kleptomaniac and compulsive liar who goes to work as a secretary for Mark Rutland (Sean Connery), and then attempts to rob him. Upon discovering this, Rutland impulsively marries the troubled beauty and attempts to uncover the reasons for her obsessive behaviour and sexual frigidity. When a terrible accident pushes his wife to the edge, Rutland forces Marnie to confront her terrors and her past in a shattering conclusion. Includes music score by Bernard Herrmann. Cast includes Tippi Hedron, Sean Connery, Diane Baker, Martin Gabel, Louise Latham.

results.title: Marloo the Red kangaroo
results.brief_description: Looks at the life history of the red kangaroo. Shows details of the birth and care of the young, and includes information on typical adult kangaroos in their natural state, in various parts of Australia. Also discusses the problem of conservation.

results.title: Marlon Brando: 'the wild one'
results.brief_description: After electrifying New York audiences with his stage performances, Marlon Brando excited - even offended the world in the screen version of “A Streetcar Named Desire” - instantly becoming a Hollywood legend, later accorded the greatest actor of his time. But the image that theatre and cinema made of him did not coincide in anyway with Brando the man. Capture the real Brando in this expose of the significant events that shaped “the wild one’s” life including interviews with his family, friends and fellow Hollywood stars (Anthony Quinn, Jane Fonda, Susannah York…). Plus rare footage from his social life as well as highlights of all his legendary screen performances.

results.title: Marlin Waters
results.brief_description: Deep sea fishing off the coast of New Zealand. Photographed largely around the Bay of Islands, which has become a centre for the sport and attracts big game fishermen from the United States, who pass on their skill to newcomers. Shows several long fights with the big fish.

results.title: Marlene
results.brief_description: Maximilian Schell has created a fascinating film, amusing and sad, imaginative and courageously put together. He presents Dietrich as a genuine star to a new generation of moviegoers. Included are scenes from “Destry Rides Again”, “Morocco”, “Witness for the Prosecution”, “Judgement at Nuremberg”. Dietrich is difficult, forgetful, egotistical, with a unique presence and an unexpectedly forthright manner.
